page.title: 09ALL SAINTS CHURCH
page.content: ALL SAINTS CHURCH IS SITUATED NEAR GREETWELL. IT WAS BUILT BETWEEN 900 AND 10,00. IT TOOK TWENTY YEARS TO BUILD. IT WAS BUILT IN THE SAXON STYLE WITH GOTHIC ARCHES. THE PULPIT IS OCTAGONAL AND THE STAINED-GLASS WINDOWS TELL THE OF THE RESURRECTION. IT HAS ONE BELL THAT WEIGHS HALF A HUNDREDWEIGHT.THE CHURCH HAS BEEN RENOVATED AFTER BEING USED AS A PIG STY FOR TWENTY YEARS.IT WAS EXTENDED DURING NORMAN TIMES TO MAKE ROOM FOR A CHANCEL.IT WAS IN THE ORIGINAL { {DOMESDAY BOOK }WHEN THE NAVE ,TOWER AND PORCH EXISTED.THE VICAR IS O.G. HAYDAY. THE GRAVEYARD IS A QUARTER OF AN ACRE IN AREA.THERE ARE 12 PEOPLE IN THE CONGREGATION AND THERE IS NO CHOIR.
